meanings.definition: The act of allocating something incorrectly or unsuitably.
meanings.sent1: The misallocation of funds led to financial problems.
meanings.sent2: The misallocation of resources caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The misallocation of snacks at the party left everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her misallocation of time was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The misallocation of responsibilities made the team confused and inefficient.

meanings.definition: The state of having allocated something in a mistaken or inappropriate way.
meanings.sent1: The misallocation of tasks resulted in chaos.
meanings.sent2: The misallocation of duties created confusion among the staff.
meanings.sent3: His misallocation of clothes made him wear mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: The misallocation of seating arrangements made the event awkward.
meanings.sent5: The misallocation of books on the shelf made finding a specific one impossible.
